My son loves this cartoon even more than the Filmation He-Man cartoon. Only Thundarr the Barbarian comes close to it's fun and action packed stories.
My son, after playing and reviewing the disc, gave it two thumbs up. Says it's a nice addition to his collection.
Product arrived on time with no defects, it played nicely on all of my players. It made a good gift for kids.

I wanted to introduce my Grandsons into the worlds of Robert E. Howard who created Conan, along with many other iconic characters.  This series is a perfect way to do this.  I have watched it with them and, hopefully, they will develop a lifelong love for the genre.
My Husband was born in 1984... In the era of strange cartoons, tv shows, music, and movies... He loves all that stuff, and he loves his cartoons like this.

I just had to make a quick review in order to see if anyone else who owns this DVD has experienced the same issue.  On Disc 1 of Conan The Adventurer Season 2 Vol. 1. there seems to be a problem with the episode entitled "The Red Brotherhood".  Towards the end of that particular episode(about 16-17 min into it), there is a noticeable line towards the top of the screen that seems to be either an animation error/defect when the episodes where first created.

Has anyone else experienced this same problem while viewing this episode? I'm curious, so please let me know.

I didn't watch this as a kid.  I thought how in the world could they make a cartoon for kids based off of Conan the Barbarian.  I saw the movie back then.  No way.  Then there was the complete Serpentor rip-off outfit and I was done.  But I love cartoons so as an adult I thought, "what the hey."  These cartoons are very entertaining in my view.  I'm glad I bought them.  Stories are not half bad and the animation is 80's based.  I like this.  I'm enjoying the story arcs.  Some of the episodes come off as single shows but there is an underlining story of collecting all the star metal and finding a cure for his parents.  Enjoyable and a lot of fun.
Love Conan the Barbarian and this series!
The product was great.
Great Thankyou
a great cartoon adventure starring CONAN.
I loved the cartoon and had to get it on DVD. I'm glad I did it was everything I expected and had a great time watching it and I recommend it to anyone who is a fan of Conan.
Pretty good
great

This series has nostalgic value for those who loved it when they were younger.  It's value is beyond that.  This particular series has strong appeal to boys and to a man's inner child.  Conan has many incarnations, and the good ones are loved by men everywhere.

Conan is a warrior, a protector, a leader and an avenger.  His skill improves with each battle.  He's a barbarian - he's not bound by society's rules.  He's guided by personal strength, courage, friendship and honor.  He needs little more than his muscles and his sword.

Long Live Conan

Had season 1, saw season 2 existed, so figured I would complete my collection. Its not the Howard Conan, or even the Marvel Conan, or the movie Conans, but its not bad I won't knock it - it is pretty good for what it is - a Conan aimed at a younger audience. Gotta find me some star-metal
One of my favorite animated series.  Right up there with Thundarr!
